state_analysis: The attempts to create the test script still fail due to the presence of an exclamation mark causing syntax errors in the shell. Each attempt to run a nonexistent script leads to errors as well.
explanation: To resolve this issue, we will create the test script again, ensuring to avoid using any problematic characters that may trigger shell errors, particularly the exclamation mark. After creating the script successfully, I will execute it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo "import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print('Test passed!')" > test_script.py
